citeinfo.title: Historical Annual Zabelii Honeysuckle First Bloom Index, Contiguous United States, 2016-Previous Year
USA National Phenology Network, Gridded Data Product Suite

descript.abstract: Historical values for the Extended Spring Index (SI-x) of First Bloom, Zabelii honeysuckle sub-model. Each pixel is assigned a day of year value for the First Bloom Index. The Extended Spring Indices are mathematical models that predict the "start of spring" (timing of leaf out or bloom for species active in early spring) at a particular location. This model was constructed using historical observations of the timing of first bloom in a cloned honeysuckle cultivar (Lonicera korolkowii 'Zabelii'). Primary inputs to the model are temperature events, beginning January 1 of each year. Layers are available for each year from 2016 onward. Input temperature data based on NOAA National Centers for Environmental Prediction (NCEP) Unrestricted Mesoscale Analysis (URMA) Products.
descript.purpose: Our NCEP-based contemporary products enable real-time information on leaf and bloom dates, before PRISM data are available. We continue to make these NCEP-based layers available from 2016 forward, to enable inter-comparison with PRISM products, and to provide continuity in data availability. The Extended Spring Indices are used to understand spatiotemporal patterns in the onset of spring, and as an indicator of climate change by both the Environmental Protection Agency and the National Climate Assessment.

attracc.attraccr: No formal attribute accuracy tests were conducted.

dataqual.logic: Data are provided as-is. No logical accuracy tests are performed beyond that done by the original data publishers.

horizpa.horizpar: A formal accuracy assessment of the horizontal positional information in the data set has not been conducted.

vertacc.vertaccr: A formal accuracy assessment of the vertical positional information in the data set has either not been conducted, or is not applicable.

citeinfo.origin: NOAA National Centers for Environmental Prediction
citeinfo.title: URMA - Contiguous United States - Grid 184 - Conus - 2.5km resolution

pubinfo.publish: NOAA National Centers for Environmental Prediction

srcinfo.srccontr: Used as authoritative data source on previous day observational data

procstep.procdesc: NCEP URMA data (hourly temperatures) are retrieved on a 24-hour cycle over the course of the year.
Spring Index values are calculated across the raster each day of the year using above mentioned climate data.
After day 250 is complete, and the Spring Index values for the raster are no longer subject to change, then the final raster is archived as a data layer of this set.

enttyp.enttypd: Table containing attribute information associated with the data set.

attr.attrdef: Extended Spring Index Value, predicting day of first bloom for Lonicera korolkowii 'Zabelii'

overview.eaover: The entity and attribute information provided here describes the tabular data associated with the data set. Please review the detailed descriptions that are provided (the individual attribute descriptions) for information on the values that appear as fields/table entries of the data set.
overview.eadetcit: The entity and attribute information was generated by the individual and/or agency identified as the originator of the data set. Please review the rest of the metadata record for additional details and information.

distinfo.distliab: These data are preliminary or provisional and are subject to revision. They are being provided to meet the need for timely best science. The data have not received final approval by the U.S. Geological Survey (USGS) and are provided on the condition that neither the USGS nor the U.S. Government shall be held liable for any damages resulting from the authorized or unauthorized use of the data.
